Type.Name: DivideByZeroException

TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable beforefieldinit DivideByZeroException extends System.ArithmeticException

Type.ThreadingSafetyStatement: All public static members of this type are safe for multithreaded operations. No instance members are guaranteed to be thread safe.

summary.para: Represents the error that is caused by an attempt to divide a number by zero.

example.para: The following example demonstrates an error that causes a exception.
example.code: Error: System.DivideByZeroException: Attempted to divide by zero. at DivideZeroTest.Main()

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

summary.para: Constructs and initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.para: This constructor initializes the property of the new instance to a system-supplied message that describes the error, such as "Attempted to divide by zero." This message takes into account the current system culture.

Docs.param: A that describes the error. The content of is intended to be understood by humans. The caller of this constructor is required to ensure that this string has been localized for the current system culture.
